tit.e: Nenryo zakki (ware paid as a tribute)
tit.cmt: eliminated description in parenthesis since these details are written below
タイトルなので語頭を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 年料雑器（ねんりょうざっき）とは、律令制において尾張国・長門国両国より中央に貢納させた陶器。
sen.e: Nenryo zakki was earthenware paid as a tribute imposed by the central government on Owari Province and Nagato Province under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

Nenryo zakki was earthenware from Owari Province and Nagato Province appointed by the central government as payments of tribute under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: changed "imposed" to "appointed"; rearranged sentence to read more understandably; fixed grammar
sen.e: Nenryo zakki was earthenware from Owari Province and Nagato Province appointed by the central government as payments of tribute under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 特に緑釉陶器を指す場合がある。
sen.e: In some cases, it specifically referred to ryokuyu toki (green-glazed ware).
In some cases, nenryo zakki referred specifically to ryokuyu toki (green-glazed ware).
In some cases, nenryo zakki referred specifically to ryokuyu toki (green-glazed ware).

sen.j: 古代の日本では、釉薬は高度な技術であり、国家の管理下にあったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that glaze technique was so valuable in ancient Japan that it was put under the control of the government.
Glaze techniques were considered so valuable in ancient Japan that they were put under the control of the government.
Glaze techniques were considered so valuable in ancient Japan that they were put under the control of the government.

sen.j: 特に中国大陸の影響を受けて緑釉陶器が平安貴族たちの間で愛されており、畿内に設置された官工房では生産が追いつかなかった。
sen.e: Especially under the influence of the Chinese continent, ryokuyu toki were very popular among the nobles in the Heian period and the production in the government craft centers established in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) could not keep up with the demand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Influenced in particular by the Chinese continent, ryokuyu toki was so popular among nobles during the Heian period that production in the government craft centers established in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) were unable to keep up with demand.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Influenced in particular by the Chinese continent, ryokuyu toki was so popular among nobles during the Heian period that production in the government craft centers established in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) were unable to keep up with demand.

sen.j: そのため、当時日本国内を代表する陶器の産地であった両国にはその貢納が求められた。
sen.e: As a result, the above two provinces, which had been the principal production areas of earthenware in Japan, were ordered to tribute the products.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, both the Owari Province and Nagato Province as principal production areas of earthenware at the time in Japan, were ordered to make tributes of their products.
sen.cmt: changed "the above two provinces" to "both the Owari Province and Nagato Province"; fixed grammar
sen.e: As a result, both the Owari Province and Nagato Province as principal production areas of earthenware at the time in Japan, were ordered to make tributes of their products.

sen.j: 従って、年料雑器として集められた陶器も国府直属の工房で製作された。
sen.e: Therefore, the earthenware that was prepared as nenryo zakki was also produced in the craft centers under the direct control of the kokufu (provincial office).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, earthenware prepared as nenryo zakki was also produced in craft centers under direct control of the kokufu (provincial offices).
Accordingly, earthenware prepared as nenryo zakki was also produced in craft centers under direct control of the kokufu (provincial offices).

sen.j: そのための原料調達などの必要経費は正税から捻出された。
sen.e: The necessary expenses for the production, such as the material costs, were subsidized by shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices' warehouse).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The necessary expenses for the production, such as material costs, were subsidized by shozei (rice tax stored in warehouses of provincial offices).
sen.cmt: changed "provincial offices' warehouse" to "warehouses of provincial offices"; fixed grammar
sen.e: The necessary expenses for the production, such as material costs, were subsidized by shozei (rice tax stored in warehouses of provincial offices).

sen.j: 延喜式には、大椀（径9.5寸）・中椀（径7寸）・小椀（径6寸）・花盤（径5.5寸）・花形塩杯（径3寸）などの規格が定められていた。
sen.e: In Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), standards of earthenware were established: for example, owan (soup bowl in big size) as 289mm, nakawan (soup bowl in middle size) as 212mm, showan (soup bowl in small size) as 182mm, kaban (plate of floral pattern with legs) as 167mm and hanagataenbai as 91mm in their diameters.
sen.cmt: 花形塩杯の定訳・読み方不明です。(仮にhanagataenbaiとして訳しました。)また、1寸＝30.3mmで換算しました。
sen.e: The Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) stipulated size standards for earthenware, such as the diameter of owan (large soup bowls) as 289mm, nakawan (medium-sized soup bowls) as 212mm, showan (small soup bowls) as 182mm, kaban (plates with a floral pattern with legs) as 167mm and hanagataenbai as 91mm.
